mcpSseUrl.title: MCP Server Sent Events (SSE) URL
mcpSseUrl.description:
MCP Server Sent Events (SSE) URL for receiving updates from the server.

Make sure that URL path ends with `/sse`

mcpUrl.title: MCP Server URL
mcpUrl.description: URL of the MCP Server for updates. Use `SSEClientTransport` if the URL ends with `/sse`; otherwise, use `HttpStreamableClientTransport`.

mcpTransportType.title: MCP transport type specification
mcpTransportType.description: This setting helps you to override the MCP transport layer if required. Use `SSEClientTransport` for Server Sent Events (2024-11-05) or `HttpStreamableClientTransport` for JSON Response Streamable HTTP (2025-03-26).

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description: HTTP headers to be sent with the request to the MCP server. If you are using Apify's MCP server, headers are NOT required

systemPrompt.title: System prompt
systemPrompt.description: System prompt for the Claude model
systemPrompt.default:
You are a helpful Apify assistant with tools called Actors.

Your goal is to help users discover the best Actors for scraping and web automation.
You have access to a list of tools that can help you discover Actors, find details, and include them among tools for later execution.

Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs.

Choose the appropriate Actor based on the conversation context. If no Actor is needed, reply directly.

Prefer Actors with more users, stars, and runs.
When you need to use an Actor, explain how it is used and with which parameters.
Never call an Actor unless it is required by the user!
After receiving an Actor's response:
1. Transform the raw data into a natural, conversational response.
2. Keep responses concise but informative.
3. Focus on the most relevant information.
4. Use appropriate context from the user's question.
5. Avoid simply repeating the raw data.
Always use 'Actor', not 'actor'. Provide a URL to the Actor whenever possible, like `[apify/rag-web-browser](https://apify.com/apify/rag-web-browser)`.
Actor execution may take some time, and results can be large. Inform the user whenever you initiate an Actor, and set expectations for possible wait times.
If possible, limit the number of results to 3, 5, or 10. Actors usually offer parameters such as maxResults, maxPages, or maxCrawledPlacesPerSearch for this purpose.
The server limits the number of results returned, but you can always request more results from paginated datasets or fetch additional data from the key-value store if needed.

modelName.title: Anthropic Claude model (Anthropic is only supported provider now)
modelName.description:
Select a model to be used for selecting tools and generating text.

- Claude Sonnet 4 - the most intelligent model
- Claude 3.7 Sonnet - highly intelligent model
- Claude 3.5 Haiku - a fastest model

llmProviderApiKey.title: LLM Provider API key (Anthropic is only supported provider now)
llmProviderApiKey.description: API key for accessing a Large Language Model. If you provide your own API key, Actor will not charge for query answered event.

modelMaxOutputTokens.title: Maximum tokens for Claude response
modelMaxOutputTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens in the Claude response. The higher the number, the longer the response time

maxNumberOfToolCallsPerQuery.title: Maximum number of tool calls per query
maxNumberOfToolCallsPerQuery.description: Maximum number of times a tool can be called with one query. Keep this number low for simple flows

toolCallTimeoutSec.title: Tool call timeout
toolCallTimeoutSec.description: Timeout for a single tool call in seconds
